snippet: The Newark Teachers Union approved a contract on Wednesday that establishes performance bonuses, which have long been opposed by national union leaders.
abstract: Newark Teachers Union approves a contract that establishes performance bonuses, which have long been opposed by national union leaders and promoted by their critics as a way to increase accountability; New Jersey school district will be one of the largest in the nation to use so-called merit pay bonuses, and union leaders argue that approval of the contract will make Newark a model across the country.
lead_paragraph: The Newark Teachers Union approved a contract on Wednesday that establishes performance bonuses, which have long been opposed by national union leaders.

headline.seo: Newark Teachers Approve Contract With Performance Bonuses
headline.main: Newark Teachers Approve a Contract With Merit Pay
headline.print_headline: Newark Teachers Approve A Contract With Merit Pay
